meanings.definition: To score or mark in advance
meanings.sent1: I will prescore the test before the students arrive.
meanings.sent2: The teacher decided to prescore the assignments to save time.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to prescore the best acorns for winter.
meanings.sent4: She managed to prescore the winning goal in the last minute of the game.
meanings.sent5: The artist would prescore the canvas before starting the painting.

meanings.definition: A score or mark made in advance
meanings.sent1: The prescore on the paper indicated the starting point for cutting.
meanings.sent2: He noticed a prescore on the wood before breaking it along the line.
meanings.sent3: The prescore on the cake helped the baker cut it evenly.
meanings.sent4: The prescore on the map showed the route to the hidden treasure.
meanings.sent5: She followed the prescore on the fabric to sew a straight line.
